page.title: 03Clubs and Societies
page.content: Scotter has a wide variety of clubs and organisations providing leisure, entertainment,education,fellowship and sport.They cater for a wide age range. They include:Guides,Brownies,Cubs and Scouts.Children under school age can attend 2 different playgroups.Scotter Ladies Club and Scotter W.I.cater for similar groups.The Good Companions Club caters for people over the age of 55 who meet for fellowship.After the church bells were rehung in 1984 a bell ringing group was formed.A Youth Centre was established in 1985.Scotter Silver Band is now sponsored by a local building firm.Football and cricket are played on the War Memorial Playing Field which also houses 3 hard tennis courts.Badminton is played in the Village Hall.Karate is popular. Flat green bowls are played.A club caters for the physically handicapped.
